intro: Astrodaucus leptocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruited astrodaucus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces slender, cylindrical fruits. Astrodaucus leptocarpus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
